title: (11600) Ubrique - 6 Diseminado la Carretera

description: Parking with a bit of a slope, but spectacular views of Ubrique

name: Estación de Servicio Repsol
title: (11600) Estación de Servicio Repsol
description: Parking with water charge and discharge just behind the gas station in their own facilities.

title: (11600) Ubrique - 1 Calle Sebastián Macías
description: Day parking behind the bullring. Closed overnight 22.00-09.00

title: (11600) Ubrique - 6A Avenida Juan de la Rosa
title_short: (11600) Ubrique - 6A Avenida Juan de la Rosa
description: Source of drinking water

title: (11600) Ubrique - 9 Diseminado la Carretera
description: Place to spend the night and visit the town on foot. Noisy, since it is the entrance and exit of the town and many cars pass by. We were interested in this place because we go to the Ubrique rally climb every year, and it is very, very close to see the rally stage. If you are a fan, it is a good place to spend the days of the rally.

name: Sierra laundry
title: (11600) Sierra laundry
description: Lavendria Sierra laundry with modern machines. Parking on site may be difficult, but 600m away from official camper parking. Nice village to walk around when waiting for your laundry to finish.

title: (11600) Ubrique - 17 Calle San Francisco
description: Water fountain

title: (11600) Ubrique - 54 Avenida de España
description: Self service laundromat within walking distance of RV parking lot Adre is Av. Spain 34.

title: (11600) Ubrique - s/n Carretera Ubrique - Benaocaz
description: Parking next to the Roman ruins of Ocuri. With spectacular views and a bar right next door, with breakfast and meals and family atmosphere.

title: (11600) Ubrique - 2 Calle Harana
description: Newly refurbished motorhome parking area with black & grey disposal plus fresh water. No EHU. Narrow street to access & steep final access road, anything >8m not likely to manage. Lovely views over pretty town & hills. Lots of cafes & bars a few minutes walk away. Supermarket nearby. **tuesdays area used for large market so no access until late afternoon**

title: (11600) Ubrique - 36 Calle Fernando Gavilán
description: Quiet parking Beautiful views

title: (11612) Benaocaz - 3331 A-374
description: Picnic spot Close to the road but quiet. View of the extraordinary sunset. There are restrooms but they were closed at the end of September.

title: (11612) Benaocaz - 9 Calle de la Fuente
description: Source with drinking water

title: (11612) Benaocaz - 7 Calle Pajaruco
description: Quiet area, lighting, no traffic, flat, ideal for one night. Next to restaurants, hiking trails...... Unobstructed mountain views with beautiful sunsets. no shadow SAT ok.

title: (11600) Ubrique -
description: I don't know how to classify this place, it doesn't have any services, other than a Picnic area nearby, it is accessed by a dirt road, and there is a long road and a lot of places to park. In the mornings quite a lot of people pass by but we did not have any problem, quite quiet and close to many places to see or to start excursions.

title: (11600) Ubrique - 27 Diseminado Bujeos Altos
description: Beautiful picnic area, spacious with sun and shade. No facilities but bins.

title: (11611) Villaluenga del Rosario - A-374
description: Villaluenga del Rosario on the road to the white villages. Artisanal cheeses. Potholing.

title: (11611) Villaluenga del Rosario - Calle Albarrada
description: Large flat land at the foot of a cliff with departure of hiking trail. Away from busy roads so absolutely quiet. No service or water.

title: (11611) Villaluenga del Rosario - A-374
description: Good place to spend the day surrounded by nature and with picnic tables. There is not much space to park.

title: () Grazalema - A-372
description: Recreational area in meadow with tables and barbecues, very wide. Sand parking area.

title: (11670) El Bosque - 102 Diseminado los Catorce
description: A picnic area with a couple of relativity flat spots for a motorhome 2km outside El Bosque. The parking is mainly on a hill is sandy and rocky. There are public toilets here also. There are no services only bins. We seen people fill their water bottles from the running stream. There are two entrances with low branches at the first so go to the second. There is a house across the road and a rooster may wake you early.

name: Camping la Torrecilla
title: (11670) Camping la Torrecilla
description: A very familiar and beautiful place, views of nature and tranquility. The owners are very friendly, affordable price.

title: (11610) Grazalema - A-372
description: Nice vantage point with a fountain. It fits only one car/ small bus/ camper.

title: (11670) El Bosque - Canada de Villamartina
description: Recreational area, with picnic tables and barbecues. It is not well cared for and there is some garbage, but it is a quiet place, with a lot of shade and with the forest river right here. Easy access by a dirt track in very good condition. Only local people walk, it is not an area full of tourism like others around, that's why we liked it. Let's keep this beautiful and accessible space clean.

title: (11670) El Bosque -
description: Go up to see the sunset, with a friend. And I saw that there is space to park motorhome or peasant and be able to spend a stay outdoors in nature

title: (11679) Benamahoma - 26 Calle la Venta
description: Renowned fountain. Fresh water of quality. The inhabitants supply themselves in large numbers. Easy access by road.

title: (11610) Grazalema - A-372
description: Panoramic view. Superb stone and covered picnic tables. About 4 to 5 seats. Prohibited at night.

title: (11679) Benamahoma - 1 Calle la Venta
description: Quiet place ideal for overnight and hiking trails, bar attached to the parking.

title: (11670) El Bosque - 18 Calle Benamahoma
description: Good place to spend the night in the forest, quiet place

title: (11670) El Bosque - 8 Calle Juan Ramón Jiménez
title_short: (11670) El Bosque - 8 Calle Juan Ramón Jiménez
description: A parking space before the bridge, flat parking, very little passage, this is not the ideal spot but we were quiet for one night.

name: Camping Los Linares
title: (11679) Camping Los Linares
description: Large camping. Very clean and organised. 50 + camp/ motorhome pitches. Warm douches very quiet in mid season. Friendly staff. Swimming pool.

title: (11670) El Bosque - 15 Poligono del Anden
description: Drinking Water Supply for free

title: (11670) El Bosque - 1 Avenida Diputacion
description: Parking area in the village for about 20 AC. Park for children and walk. Quiet starting at 00h. Close to typical shops and areas to eat and near the beautiful path of the Majaceite river towards Benamahoma

name: Area de Servicio de Autocaravanas | El Bosque
title: (11670) Area de Servicio de Autocaravanas | El Bosque
title_short: (11670) Area de Servicio de Autocaravanas | El Bosque
description: I have been coming to this town, since I have great friends here, even before being a caravanner. Having an overnight area here is wonderful. There are neighbors who don't see it well and after being here for a few days I have verified that sometimes we have what we deserve. I have been able to verify how, despite the fact that there is a place designated for dumping, there were buses going here that, while they were parked, opened valves and gradually dumped, the ones with a gasoline generator set, they had it running late at night, bothering the the neighbors and other caravaners. Let's have civility please, so we will have more opportunities and places, and we will be better seen and treated. Congratulations on the app.

title: (11670) El Bosque - 30 Calle los Perales
description: Parking on the street. It is level. Very quiet place to spend the night. Nothing is heard, only the sound of a nearby river. When we arrived there were several Ac and Campers staying overnight. Recommendable.

title: (11670) El Bosque - Calle Rafael Alberti
description: Parking near children's park. Parking along the roadway. Almost no traffic. On Sunday a little parking of vehicles that visit the museum of cheese "El Bosqueno". Quiet place, lighted and well placed to visit the city.

title: (11670) El Bosque - 15 Calle Jaen
description: We did not sleep here but I believe it is possible without any problems. park to right side of road. we only posted up during the day. In quiet area away from town and homes, opposite a natural reserve with a natural stream with small beach to relax. A good hiking trail departs from this section also. fairly flat parking space for 1-2 small vans. Less flat space for more. great 4G reception and just 3 mins from pueblo El Bosque. not ideal for bigger campers. the hostel that you park next to is currently closed, to your benefit. drinking water fountain right there

title: (11670) El Bosque - Camino del Castillejo
description: Botanical Garden Parking

title: (11610) Grazalema - A-372
description: Small area next to a hiking trail accessible from the road but hidden and well located. Incredible views. The only thing that hiking enthusiasts begin to pass very early.

title: (11670) El Bosque - 16 Camino del Espino
description: Parking at the start of the hike. A very quiet place without outside light. At the edge of a river in 1 min and a half. Road with potholes for the last 300 meters. I stayed there all day and all night (no sign indicates prohibition) 4min by car you are at a Bar / Restaurant at the edge of the water (easy parking space)

name: Camping Tajo Rodillo
title: (11610) Camping Tajo Rodillo
description: Located on the outskirts of Grazalema. With a beautiful view of the mountains. Mainly intended for tents. There are 5 parking spaces for motorhomes. The place has a pool, showers and WiFi.

title: (11610) Grazalema - 76 Calle Nueva
description: Quiet place to park, with views of the town the stay was during the week on weekends the same thing changes, please take care of this way of traveling.

title: (11610) Grazalema - A-372
description: Two kilometers before Grazalema, shaded car park with a nice view over the village and the Sierra Margarita.

title: (29380) Cortes de la Frontera - Unnamed Road
title_short: (29380) Cortes de la Frontera - Unnamed Road
description:
Beautiful spot in the middle of the forest with a very nice view. Next to a small road, but hardly any traffic. 

Pls keep it clean

title: (11610) Grazalema - 4 Calle Agua
description: Water tap point. Only for filling jerry cans, among other things.

title: (11610) Grazalema - CA-9104

title: (29380) Cortes de la Frontera - Unnamed Road
title_short: (29380) Cortes de la Frontera - Unnamed Road
description: A space of tranquility, in the middle of cork oaks, on the edge of a road in poor condition but passable.

title: (29380) Cortes de la Frontera - 21 Calle Alamos
title_short: (29380) Cortes de la Frontera - 21 Calle Alamos
description: Parking lot. No services. Right in the heart of the village adjacent to the bullfighting ring. Flat level gravel surface. Suitable for small to medium motorhomes but take care as wrong turns can lead to narrow roads making it difficult for larger vans. Good spot to park for the day. Didn’t stay overnight but no prohibition signs. Pretty village. Take note: if parking at the far end away from the entrance there is a bar/pub so there could be noise in the evenings/early hours …you’ve been warned ;)

title: (29380) Cortes de la Frontera - A-373
description: Cork viewpoint. Suitable for spending the night in the Sierra Grazalema. nice views at sunrise. Next to the road, but it is very quiet at night.

title: (11610) Grazalema - 3 A-372
description: Grazalema, on the road to the white villages.

title: (29380) Cortes de la Frontera - 20 Ciudad Deportiva Nicolás Alonso
title_short: (29380) Cortes de la Frontera - 20 Ciudad Deportiva Nicolás Alonso
description: Parking at the abandoned Hotel Sol y Sierra. Nice park above with a water point. Children's playground nearby. Near center. Access with a large mobile home is only possible from the main road 36.619399, -5.341407 (Passeo de los Acacias).

title: (11610) Grazalema - Unnamed Road
description: Good place.

title: (11610) Grazalema - CA-9104
description: Road ledge where you can park a van. It is attached to the road but hardly any cars pass at night. Great views

title: () Algar - Unnamed Road
description: Place for a vehicle at the edge of a dirt road in the middle of nature. The small river on the side brings a great "zen sound" for the night. Not perfectly flat. There was a bigger place on the same road before, but families were already there and were organizing a small party.

title: (11610) Grazalema - CA-9104
description: View point. Can be windy!!

title: (29392) Jimera de Libar - 14 Diseminado Poligono 2

Several areas for parking under the trees Swimming authorized and access provided a sign indicates that camping is prohibited

title: (29490) - 19 Diseminado Poligono 12
description: In the middle of nature, a lost place on the edge of a small road, with shade and a view of the mountain, very beautiful and quiet

title: (11610) Grazalema - CA-9104
description: Magnificent views of the lake and the mountain at 360 degrees. Quiet despite the roadsides and flat terrain. Internet network.

title: (29392) Barriada de la Estación - 14 Paseo de la Ermita
title_short: (29392) Barriada de la Estación - 14 Paseo de la Ermita

title: () Zahara de la Sierra -

title: (29392) - 5 Diseminado Poligono 3
description: Jimera de Libar town station area. Nice small area, brand new. Fit about seven motorhomes.  ideal for the routes of the artezuelas, the mills and the plain. There is a shop in the station and a bar. Great for rural tourism. Let’s keep this nice and clean.

title: () Cortes de la Frontera - MA-512
description: Picnic area with free barbecues. Alcornocales Natural Park.

title: (29370) Benaoján - 22 Partida la Pileta
description: Small free parking along a cul de sac road overlooking the valley. Accessible to all templates, stabilized and overall level, the place is very quiet. No service, 4G very perfectible. Attention in the day and mainly WE, there can be a lot of cars.

title: (11688) El Gastor - Unnamed Road
description: On the side of the road, just a free public fountain source. With the possibility of direct filling of the tank. Poster of the town hall indicating that this water has no sanitary control.

title: (11688) Zahara de la Sierra -
description: Just in front of a small amusement park in the middle of nature after the village of Zahara, we spent a very quiet night there. Accessible to large motorhomes.

title: (29490) El Colmenar - 40 Avenida Santiago
description: Hi. Nice town with walking options. See the boards in town. I asked the local policeman, who said it’s ok to park Day/Night in the town. Just not out of town as it is a national park. Good Bar/Restaurant in town with friendly locals. Enjoy.

title: (29490) Cortes de la Frontera - 60b MA-512
description: Parking next to the train station. Easy access. Tarred and relatively flat. Of course there are trains. They're loud. Last train around 11pm according to the timetable. All shops in town.

title: (29490) El Colmenar -
description: Quiet place next to the river and next to the town. As in all of El Colmenar, the train can be heard, but the last one passed around 11:00 p.m.

title: (29480) - 1 Diseminado Presa del Corchado
description: Quiet place next to a river, with approximately 4 parking spaces. Near the El Caiman ferrata. It has a dirt road but it does not have great difficulty. Surrounded by eucalyptus trees that provide shade. Recommendable.

title: (29490) Cortes de la Frontera - 14 Calle Buitreras
title_short: (29490) Cortes de la Frontera - 14 Calle Buitreras
description: On the side of the train track, at the beginning of the street that takes you to the route of the vultures or bathing in the river, shops and bars in the town square 5 minutes away.

title: () El Gastor - A-2300
description: Large "shaded" area dedicated to water sports at the end of the lake, open this 17th of April 2017 but gate can be padlocked, several motorhomes, ideal for dogs and very quiet.

title: (29490) Cortes de la Frontera - Calle Buitreras
title_short: (29490) Cortes de la Frontera - Calle Buitreras
description: Parking for a very nice hike, do not follow the big pipe that goes up but go to the bottom then follow the river on your left. 1 hour walk very beautiful landscapes

title: (11687) El Gastor -
description: Not paved, quiet and relatively flat outdoors for max. 5-8 vehicles on a promontory. No shade, no service and no prohibition signs. Satisfactory mobile phone prohibited at night.

title: (11660) Prado del Rey -

title: (29370) Benaoján - 43 Calle la Linea
description: Spring water and here you can very well stop with the camper. great view of the mountains and the white village.

title: (11687) El Jaral -
description: Location with beautiful view of the lake. We had a very quiet night.

title: (11610) Grazalema - A-2300

title: (29370) Benaoján - 42 Avenida Acceso de la Estacion
title_short: (29370) Benaoján - 42 Avenida Acceso de la Estacion
description: Fountain at the foot of the road, convenient to fill the tank of the van

title: (29400) Ronda - Unnamed Road
description: Quiet place by the lake, a little steep road to get there. No service. Camping forbidden

title: (29370) Benaoján - 6 Avenida Constitucion

description: Parking next to a playground for the elderly, very clean and with a fountain. Very quiet to spend the night.

title: (29430) Montecorto - Unnamed Road
description: Several small pitches for a motorhome on the edge of the path which leads to another spot a little lower. Here, it's flatter, the view is prettier and vehicles that are a bit wide are not scratched by the shrubs that invade the path below... Very quiet site.

title: (29493) Benadalid - A-369
description: Mirador de los Castañares. Viewpoint on the road from Juzgar to Gaucin. The ground is not uniform, slight slope. Very quiet to spend the night.

title: (11639) Algar - 39 Calle San José

title_short: (11688) Zahara de la Sierra - 7 Calle Jose Maria Peman

You have to be careful with the trees that are on the promenade and that invade part of the parking area, it is valid with care for large volume vans and small Camper, refrain motorhomes.

title: (11688) Zahara - CA-8102
description: Place it in the shade at the edge of a small river where it can swim. On the road but quiet. Ideal for a lunch.

title: (29491) Algatocín - Calle Cereria
description: Quiet place with children park and pinpon tables, has picnic area and water fountain

description: Free zone next to the lake under a car park

address.street: 7 Calle Félix Rodríguez de la Fuente

title: (11688) Zahara - CA-9104
description: Parking next to the road, great location for sightseeing and overlooking the dam. I guess at night little traffic, so it can also be a good place for the night.

title: (29360) Montejaque - 2 Calle Alcalde Antonio Guzman L
title_short: (29360) Montejaque - 2 Calle Alcalde Antonio Guzman L

title: (29494) Atajate - 8 Calle los Maestros
description: Parking in Atajate. Great esplanade. From the Town Hall they indicated us the casket to fill and the one for emptying the gray. Black cannot be emptied and there is a beautiful route that surrounds the town.

title: (11688) El Gastor - A-2300
description:
Small parking for a discreet place down the road. Here also beautiful views of the lake. It must be recognized that sloping access is not necessarily within the reach of the campsite owner who fears for his machine. My truck, 7m, went well.
Forbidden to stay for the night.

title: (29491) Algatocín -
description: Just a good spot to stop and enjoy. Flat area with views.

title: (11688) El Gastor - A-2300
description: Corner next to the road, a few meters from the lake. incredible views in the morning. At night a lot of air, we had to sleep inside the camper on the bottom. Although it is next to the road, hardly any vehicles pass.

title: (11639) Algar -
description:
SANTA MARGARITA RURAL FINCA EL PIKETA. Private property with all services for AC. An ideal place to rest, enjoy nature and its animals. Spectacular views of the Guadalcacín reservoir. Pepe ElPiketa super caring and best professional. 10 points for Pepe.
Danger! Access to the farm works via a transponder for the gate. This transponder is located on the right side of the gate, in a mini safe with a numeric code.
You get the number code when you call Pepe.
Pepe's phone number or email address can be found under the menu item "Contact".
Of particular note are the shaded picnic areas and children's playgrounds, which are also shaded, the pool and the free-roaming horses and sheep.

title: (29491) Benalauría - 50 MA-8306
description: Only possible place, if you are lucky, typical balcony parking on El Valle del Genal, refrain from “spacecraft” maximum 6.35m. Quiet town where to make some magnificent path (towards Benarraba, Genalguacil and some other town) we have slept and silence Even being at the main entrance is absolute.

title: (11688) Zahara de la Sierra -
description: Small parking lot near the lake with a nice view of the surrounding mountains. small picnic area right next door and start of the hike 5 minutes away on foot. ideal for swimming in the lake or fishing. Forbidden at night.

title: (29430) Montecorto -
description: Old ruins which could provide a possible wildcamp if you’re walking or on a bike.

title: (29491) Algatocín - 1 Calle Ereta
description: Water point

title: (29430) Montecorto -
description: No services. Just area to have a stop and get a cup of coffee in the middle of mountains. Also You can have a nap here. Be careful while driving in. Slag substrate.

title: (29360) Montejaque - 4 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Parking next to the cemetery of Montejaque. Very quiet and with a couple of areas without light. Perfect to spend the night From here comes a Ferrata

title: (29491) Algatocín - A-369
description: A belvedere in the middle of nature, superb view! Small quiet corner at All Saints' Day to spend the night. Parking lot with tables and bins.

title: (29370) - 1 Partida Dehesilla
description: Small parking land beaten just above La Cueva del Gato, beautiful spot, road above but not embarrassing. Very nice seen on the mountains. In addition, quiet place!

title: (29490) Benarrabá -
description: Observatory and surveillance of the mountains. You can sleep and the very friendly guards offer you to use the service. Please, leave everything clean and cared for, it is a natural area. The access is very complicated, you have to go up a fairly steep ramp with potholes and gravel, but with great care, it is worth trying. Incredible views - we watched sunset, watch the moon rise and sunrise.

title: (29490) Benarrabá - A-369
description: Parking del ventorro las Corchas, you can park during the day, the entrance is a bit narrow but inside it is very good, the place is perfect to go on a hiking route and have lunch. The staff are lovely and you eat very well.

title: (29430) Montecorto - 2 Arrabal Sup-M
description: Small tap to fill up at the side of the road. No parking but road is quiet to pull over. We filled up here before heading to a nature parking spot.

title: (29430) Montecorto - 6 Arrabal Sup
description: Small landing for only 1 vehicle, and quite flat. The parking lot is right in front but it has a lot of unevenness and this place is flat. In the town there are bakeries, cafeterias and sources of drinking water. We had a fairly quiet night.

title: (29430) Montecorto - 4 Plaza Andalucía
description: Large parking lot of land next to a pine forest, rubbish and recycling bins inside the car park, children's playground inside the car park, site very quiet and 2 minutes from the town center on foot, the sun shines.

title: (11580) San José del Valle - Km.14 A-2201
title_short: (11580) San José del Valle - Km.14 A-2201

title_short: (29380) Cortes de la Frontera Andalusia - 10 Diseminado Poligono 1
description: Good car park to take a walk to Pico del Aljibe. Stood here during the day. There are no signs that staying overnight is prohibited. Parking lot is fairly level with waste containers.

title: (29480) Gaucín - 4 Diseminado Zona el Ventorro
description: Nice corner to stay and nice viewpoint. Road is little busy, but a little windy that night.

title: (29360) Montejaque - MA-8403
description: Grass parking lot among the olive trees near Cueva De Hundidero. Nice mountain views near the road but few cars during the day. Good stopover and perfect for walking up to the cave. You are not allowed to go further in, but the 1 hour hike (round trip) to get there is really nice. No service and no waste.

title: (29380) Cortes de la Frontera -
description:
Little corner of paradise in a territory completely lacking in bivouacs!
very easy access for all vehicles.
In the shade and in the company of a few cows in the neighboring field.

title: (11650) Villamartin - CA-8101
description: Picnic area with toilets (not very clean) games for children ... Can be a place where we could spend the night (to be confirmed). We were just passing there.

title: (29480) Gaucín - 1 Diseminado la Calera
description: Park overlooking Gaucin, in an extension of the park there is a fountain with drinking water, convenient to carry water.

title: (29480) Gaucín - 7 Carretera Algeciras
description: Petrol station with possibility to fill up with water and check tire pressure

name: Área de Servicio para Autocaravanas
title: (29490) Área de Servicio para Autocaravanas
description: 5 pitches for motorhomes at the entrance to the village with 5 service terminals and emptying. Parking is free, electricity and water are chargeable. You have to call a phone number and eventually someone will come by and turn on the tap and electricity.

title: (29480) Gaucín - 1 Ds Ventorro San Antonio
description: Spot a few kilometers from Gaucin (magnificent village), isolated from the road below and hidden from any dwelling. Beautiful view of the mountains and the valley, you can even see the sea and the Rock of Gibraltar in the distance. Wild goats around as neighbours. Flat land and easy to access. Only b mol, a high voltage line.

title: (29480) Gaucín - 168 Calle Luis de Armiñan
description: Free drinking water fountain. Also accessible with larger cars.

title: (29480) Gaucín - 22 Calle Jacobo Real
description: Parking on the side of the road at the entrance to the village. Room for 3 camping cars

title: (29480) Gaucín - 1 Carretera Ronda Jimena
description: Roadside parking, allows parking at the large Cc in the direction of the road, just at the end of the car park.

title: (29480) Gaucín - 4 Calle Jacobo Real
description: Parking day or night, very quiet, we parked for the night against the shed, practically flat floor, to know that Astra passes. Ideal to visit village and castle.

name: CIVA
title: (11680) CIVA
description: Paragliding and Hanggliding pilots welcome! Parking facility by CIVA, freshwater, WC, shower, pool and bar are at disposal for guests. No electricity provided. Nice place in familiar and quiet surroundings. 20 minutes footwalk to the center of Algodonales. Small bars and restaurants within 5 min. Distance.

title: (11680) Arenal - Carr. de Antequera
description: Very quiet place to spend the night

title: (11680) Algodonales - 3 Diseminado el Arenal
description: Manned launderette, open Monday to Friday. From 09.30 to 13.30.

title: (29460) Alpandeire - MA-7307
description: Parking with great views.

title: (11680) Algodonales - 3 Diseminado Huerta del Fresno
description: Motorhome area at the entrance of the town, it is not necessary to enter the town to access the Motorhome area, thus avoiding loss of location or traffic problems. Urban center 500 meters. The Algonodonales Town Hall page offers more information and directions. Flat place, with some shade, benches and space for about 50 motorhomes. It is the fairground of the town that is used when there is no fair. Beautiful town, with a great atmosphere all year round and the possibility of doing numerous adventure activities. Cheap restaurants and homemade food.

title: (11680) Algodonales - 5 A-384
description: Free parking without service. There is a restaurant next door and opposite a gas station with a 3/4 thread tap to take water

name: CAMPING GENAL
title: (29492) CAMPING GENAL
description: Jubrique, MA-8305. GENERAL CAMPING

title: (29400) Ronda - 7 Partida los Villalones
description: creek and bridges

title: (11680) Algodonales - Pk. 43 A-384
description: Free water at Repsol gas station to refill vans or bottles.

title: (11687) El Jaral - CA-0419
description: Flat gravel area next to the road and the viewpoint.

name: Camping San Juan
title: (29492) Camping San Juan
description: Camping "San Juan" Place to relax and enjoy nature, with lots of native trees, general river at the foot of the campsite ... Very cordial and friendly service. Suggestions: grilled sausage skewer with Quejigo wood ... In male brown bread! For sale San Juan?

title: (11687) El Gastor - 42 CA-0419
description: Place with tables to eat in the shade of a pine forest. Several hiking trails depart from here. Nice view of the Gastor village.

title: (11680) Algodonales - 17 Calle Canalejas
description: Municipal parking very city. Forbidden to vehicles over 5m

title: (29490) - 27 Diseminado Poligono 1
description: Quiet place to have lunch next to the deep stream, you can also cool off in a small pool, leaving the paved path to the right is the footbridge path about 4 or 5 km of very easy path for all audiences.

title: (11680) Algodonales - Carretera de Antequera
description: Ideal place to rest and spend the day. Guadalete river at 20 meters.

title: (11687) El Gastor - 11 Calle Alambique
description: Parking at the entrance of the village on the road to Setenil. Quiet site with several hiking routes that leave the same town.

title: (11680) Algodonales - 49 Avenida de la Constitución
description: Hardware store Rodríguez, ideal to buy a blue BUTSIR gas bottle of 2.8 kg. It's at number 54, on Avenida de la Constitución, opposite the bakery. Ramón is the owner and he is very friendly.

title: (11639) Algar -
description: Very nice spot right on the water next to an old road that leads to the reservoir. The entrance to the square is blocked by a gate, but this only serves to keep the cows indoors in the surrounding fields. You can find out by reading the signs or asking the locals. Nobody was bothered by our presence here. So to close the gate behind you again! It could be that cows are walking around here, but we didn't see any.

title: (29460) Alpandeire - 2 Avenida de Andalucia
description: Free parking located behind a café / restaurant closed in low season. Overlooking the village of Alpandeira and the valley, the view is admirable. Accessible to all sizes, stabilized, no service but optimal satellite and 4G reception. Quiet, shaded parking, 300 meters from the center by a pedestrian-only lane. Near the viewpoint of Fray Léopoldo de Alpandeire and a church under construction, the place is recommended for its serenity.

title: (29460) Alpandeire - 44 Avenida de Andalucia
description: Esplanade at the entrance of the town. Parking area with easy access. We stayed overnight without incident.

title: (29460) Alpandeire - 40 Avenida de Andalucia
description: Below a busy road, at the foot of the Fray Léopoldo de Alpandeire viewpoint, this free car park is 300 meters from the village center. Shaded, stabilized and accessible to all sizes, it offers an exceptional panoramic view of the village and the valley. No services devolved to motorhomes except a water tap, satellite reception and optimal 4G.

title: (29460) Alpandeire -
description: Drinking water fountain

title: (11680) Algodonales - Avenida de la Fuente Alta
title_short: (11680) Algodonales - Avenida de la Fuente Alta
description: Free parking in front of a bar, 50 meters from a fountain to drink water and 5 min from the center

title: (29400) Ronda - 1158 Lugar Partido Rural Sancho Jaen
title_short: (29400) Ronda - 1158 Lugar Partido Rural Sancho Jaen
description: Nice place next to a gravel road just before the level crossing. There is a small stream with a bathing area. We stayed here for one night and didn't feel like we were bothering anyone. Trains practically never run and cars passed about 5 that evening.

title: (11680) Algodonales - 77 Avenida de Andalucia
description: A source of drinkable mountain water that tastes better than the surrounding water, locals also come to fill cans here. Small car park minute stop in front authorized to take water.

title: (29400) Rosalejo - a 369
description: Natural source. No chlorine. You can fill up small canisters. No hose needed.

title: (29492) Genalguacil - 2 Diseminado el Cerrillar
description: Parking on the outskirts of town 500 meters. With a motorhome you cannot go through its streets. Better to leave here. The town is worth it.

title: (11320) Jimena de la Frontera - San Pablo de Buceite
title_short: (11320) Jimena de la Frontera - San Pablo de Buceite
description: Small spot at the edge of the river. Clean, 20 m below a playground. Access by a path between bamboos, ok for vans but not for motorhomes. The road (bridge) is not very far but little noise.

title: (11580) San José del Valle - A-2201
description: Small place by the lake in San José del Valle

title: (29400) Ronda - MA-487
description: Full nature breathtaking views of Grazalema Slightly removed from the small road. gravel and grass parking. Quiet night. free no water.

title: (29492) Genalguacil - 2 Avenida Estepona
description: Small car park at the entrance to the village. Flat and beautiful view. Except Tuesday market day.

title: (11320) Jimena de la Frontera - 6 A-405
description: Gasolinera Repsol, for refueling, free drainage of gray water, waste water and filling with clean water. There is also washing for Motorhome.

title: (29492) Genalguacil - 10 Calle la Lomilla
description: Large parking in two terraces. Attention accessible only to vans arranged of maximum 6 meters, possible night, super calm with exceptional panorama. Not very flat, desirable wedges.

title: (29492) Jubrique - 14 Diseminado Bollaco
description: Parking located at the top of the village. Quiet area with water, picnic table and good views. Flat area. It is better to go around the town through the area of the hermitage than to cross it (very steep and narrow slope).

title: (29480) Casares - A-377
description: A corner of paradise on the edge of a nice little refreshing river. Leave the road to enter a small path. Rather for fitted vans. For motorhomes, access seems narrow, but there is also parking at the beginning of the road.

title: (29400) Ronda - 49 Partida los Molinos
description: Parking in nature with views of the Ronda bridge. Silent and in nature. On the way to the hermitage there are several individual parking areas.

title: (29400) Ronda - 661 Partida los Molinos
description: Easy access source, although it is not threaded and it is difficult to attach a hose

title: (29492) Genalguacil - 20 MA-8304
description: Quiet place at the entrance of the village next to a park for children

title: (29462) Júzcar -
description: Esplanade where trails start. Very quiet, only goats and sheep are heard at night.

title: (29400) Ronda - Ctra. de los Molinos
description: Good spot to park your van, stay the night and walk down to the bridge. the road further to the bridge get narrow and the first park pretty steep.

title: (11650) Villamartin - A-373
description: Parking next to the gas station. Toilets and water available. Ask at the gas station if you can stay. Close to the supermarket 5 minutes walk. Next to Villamartin.

title: (11650) Villamartín - A-384
description: Repsol station to collect water, and car wash services, propane cylinders

title: (11180) Alcalá de los Gazules - A-375
description: Quiet picacho.Endroit recreation area stuck to the road, but with minimal traffic. BBQ area and children's area. Perfect for making beautiful walks (the climb to the summit is recommended).

title: (29400) Ronda - 205 Partida Rosalejo
description: Nice point on the slipping in the car

title: (29393) Ronda - Carretera de los Molinos
description: Spot below the street.  Accessible via a gravel road that is easy to drive on.  Enough space for 3-4 vans or mobile homes.  The view of the mountains with is also very nice.  There's a bit of junk lying around..

name: Camping El Sur | Área de Autocaravanas
title: (29400) Camping El Sur | Área de Autocaravanas
title_short: (29400) Camping El Sur | Área de Autocaravanas
description: RV park of the campsite. The pitch is 2 km from the hospital and 500 m from the bus stop, restaurant and supermarket. 2 km from the historical area of Ronda (bars, restaurants, services). Petrol station 1.3 km and 2.5 km from the new bridge, symbol of Ronda. Neat, quiet place surrounded by nature.

name: Camping El Sur
title: (29400) Camping El Sur
description: Camping El Sur Very well maintained, clean and friendly. Very nice sanitary facilities and pool. Beautiful pitches. Good starting point to visit Ronda.

title: (29400) Ronda - A-369
description: Nice parking with view to Ronda and mountains around. Possible for overnight or for short stopover. About 2km far from Ronda center.

title: (11180) Alcalá de los Gazules - A-375
description: Picnic area next to the road with an embankment to park just before the recreation area of the Picacho trail. It does not have easy access and there is little flat space. We spend the night quietly in summer (August). In the morning some cyclists and motorcyclists making a route along the road. Quite good for one night and making the climb to Mt.

title: (29462) Júzcar - Av. Havaral
description: Siding by the side of the road, under a huge holm oak, with lots of shade. Garbage cans and an untreated water source next to it. We slept a very quiet night, cars passing from 9 in the morning

title: (29462) Júzcar - Avenida Havaral
description: A few places nearby for the night. At 150 meters from the village, which is a beautiful village Smurf, worth the visit.

name: Acinipo (Roman town, archaeological site)
title: (29400) Acinipo (Roman town, archaeological site)
description: Parking of the Acinipo ruins, the ruins are only open in the morning until 2.30 p.m. We just picnic but I think it is possible to sleep without problems. Parking in the middle of nature. Accessible to motorhomes. Without any service, please leave with your waste.

title: (29400) Ronda - 1955 Carretera de los Molinos
description: Mini-parking with views of the Ronda bridge, a few dozen meters above the parking lot of the hostel. The ground is not flat and would not be suitable for pernocting, but it is ideal for a picnic with a view!

title: (29400) Ronda - 19 Calle Antonia Molina
description: Street 1km from downtown, with plenty of parking available, easy access.

title: (29400) Ronda - 43 Plaza Península Ibérica
description: Spectacular views. No services, but very quiet

title: (11330) Jimena de la Frontera - A-405
description: Large parking for the cemetery. Quiet night unlike the parking lots in the surrounding villages. Shade, 4G and fresh water accessible in the nearby cemetery.

title: (29462) Júzcar - Camino a Los Riscos
description: Free space a little above the little-traveled street. Perfect for one night, nice view.

title: (29400) Ronda - Carretera de los Molinos
description: Pretty flat spot right in the turn. Space for two vans <8m, no service.

title: () Júzcar - Camino de Pujerra
description: Very large parking in Júzcar.

title: (29462) Júzcar - MA-7303
description: Parking at the roadside at the entrance to juzcar. Little passage at night, good to spend a night there before leaving for hiking or canyoning.

title: (29400) Ronda - 27 Carretera de los Molinos
description:
Small more or less flat land below a small road.
Perfect day or night, for 3 or 4 vans or small motorhomes.
Absolute calm and view of the upper town and the very pleasant surrounding countryside.

title: (29400) Ronda - 2 Plaza Pruna
description: Next to a park with playground and picnic tables. Close to the city centre, 10 minutes from the new bridge. As everywhere in Ronda there are so-called ‘security guards’ in yellow vest knocking on the campers begging for money. It’s free parking and if everyone keeps saying no they leave.

title: (29400) Ronda - 1 Calle las Flores
description: Parking along this road. Slopping Hill. Easy access to town centre and other monuments of interest. No services.

title: (29400) Ronda - 3B Calle Bella Vista
description: Quiet, flat and close place to visit the city on foot (8min). It is a residential area, with more than 30 parking spaces.

name: Camping Alcornocales
title: (11330) Camping Alcornocales
description: Jimena de la Frontera, C-3331. Camping Alcornocales
